section.title: Create a Button that Updates ControlBar Text Using an Action

step.description: In the UX Builder open the Controls page check the Mobile checkbox.
Open the Panel menu on the left and select the [Panel Card] option to add a Panel Card to the component.
Highlight the Panel Card. Open the Containers menu and select the [Container] option.
Select 'PanelHeader' from the Container Type list and click 'Insert After'.
Highlight the Panel Header. Open the Other Controls menu and click [ControlBar] to add a ControlBar inside the Panel Header.
Highlight the ControlBar. In the properties list on the right click on the 'ControlBar properties' property to open the ControlBar Builder.
On the ControlBar Builder's 'Data' pane click the Add Data Item button.
Give the data item a Setting name of 'appName' and a value of 'My First Application'. Click OK
Open the 'Items' pane and click the Add ControlBar Item button.
Select 'html' from the Item Type radio buttons and click OK.
Click the [...] button next to the HTML text item property. This is in the ControlBar Item Properties list under HTML Settings.
Double click on {appName} to add it to the editor and click OK. The HTML text property should now read {appName}.
Open the ControlBar Layout pane. Click the Add Layout button. Give the layout the name 'Layout1' and click OK.
Click the 'Add Line' button
Hit the 'Add' button under the 'Middle' section in the Edit Layout Line dialog. Select the HTml1 item that you defined on the Items pane. Click OK and OK again to close the ControlBar Builder.
On the Controls page highlight the [PanelHeader End:PANELHEADER_1] tag. Open the 'Other Controls' menu and select [Button] to add a button underneath the Panel Header.
Double click on the button control to open the Edit Click Event dialog.
Choose the 'Action Javascript' setting and click the 'Add New Action' button.
Type 'bar' into the Filter list and then in the 'Actions' list select the 'ControlBar Actions' option and click OK.
In the List Control Actions dialog click the [...] button next to the 'Action name' property and select Update ControlBar Data from the list.
Set the 'ControlBar Id' property to be 'CONTROLBAR_1'.
Click the [...] button next to the Data variables to update property. Select 'appName' from the list and click OK.
Click the [...] button next to the 'Data variable values' property. Assign appName a new value and click OK. The value should look something like this:
Save the new action.
Highlight the button control. In the Button Properties section of the properties list change the 'Button text' property to read 'Change text'
Run the Component in Live Preview.
When you click the Change Text button you should see the ControlBar change as well.
